result.name: british-geological-survey-bgs-geophysical-survey-1990-cd54-irish-sea-19-dec-1990-to-21-dec-1990
result.notes: This geophysical survey has been carried out by British Geological Survey (BGS), the survey took place in December 1990 in the Irish Sea on board the RRS Charles Darwin. The purpose was to collect gravity data as part of the UK continental shelf survey programme at the start of a University of Cambridge cruise. Sea floor data were collected using echo sounder. Gravity and magnetic data were acquired. These data are archived by BGS. BGS Survey mentioned in University of Cambridge OCEAN site survey cruise (CD54/90) report on BODC website. No BGS survey report currently available.

resources.description: GeoIndex allows users to search for information about BGS data collections covering the UK and other areas world wide. Access is free, the interface is easy to use, and it has been developed to enable users to check coverage of different types of data and find out some background information about the data. More detailed information can be obtained by further enquiry through the website.
